snippet: Militants spilling over the border from Syria seized control of Iraq’s second-largest city in the most stunning success yet of a rapidly widening insurgency that threatens to drag the region into war.
abstract: Sunni militants aligned with the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria spill over border from Syria and seize control of Mosul, Iraq, country's second largest city; assault is the most stunning success yet in rapidly widening insurgency that threatens to drag the region into war.

byline.original: By SUADAD AL-SALHY and TIM ARANGO
byline.contributor: Suadad Al-Salhy reported from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Istanbul. Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Amman, Jordan, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Militants spilling over the border from Syria seized control of Iraq’s second-largest city in the most stunning success yet of a rapidly widening insurgency that threatens to drag the region into war.

headline.main: Sunni Militants Drive Iraqi Army Out of Mosul
headline.print_headline: Sunni Militants Drive Iraqi Army From Big City

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
